I am a postgraduate student in the University of Glasgow's
[Institute of Neuroscience and Psychology](http://www.gla.ac.uk/researchinstitutes/neurosciencepsychology/).
I work with [Benedict Jones](https://www.gla.ac.uk/researchinstitutes/neurosciencepsychology/staff/benjones/) and [Lisa Debruine](https://www.gla.ac.uk/researchinstitutes/neurosciencepsychology/staff/lisadebruine/)

## Research Interests
My research interests focus on the perceptions of facial attractiveness.  My work investigates that whether people regard facial attractiveness as a signal to predict biological quality, particularly health in human.


## Education Background

    * University of Glasgow, Glasgow, UK

* Bachelor of Science in Clinical Psychology  (09/2011-07/2015)
    * Southern Medical University (SMU), Guangzhou, China

## Research Experience
I worked in the Guangzhou Crisis Rdesearch in Intervention Centre as a research assistant for tow years, during which I conducted an independent research about high-risk suicidal calls from Guangzhou crisis hotline. In this project,I was responsible for data archiving, statistical analysis, and final project write-up.
